raw_comment:
Thanks to all the students who responded. Here are some of the catchy headlines that we received: "The Opposing Futures in the Eyes of Different Generations" by Helena of Pewaukee High School and “The Ages of Optimism” by Zoe, both from Wisconsin, "Generation Battle: Is the World Getting Better or Worse?" by Taim of Gladeville Middle School in Mt. Juliet, Tennessee. 

You can continue to post responses.  Please check back by Friday, Feb. 11 to see the Reveal with a link to the original New York Times article, some questions about the graph, and a few Stat Nuggets.

Please visit our archive to see all graphs in this series (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphs).

View our archives that link to all past releases, organized by topic (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphsTopicIndex), graph type (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphsTypeIndex) and Stat Nugget (tinyurl.com/NYTGraphsStatNuggetsIndex). 

Signing off – Sharon Hessney of Boston, who sees hope in the optimism of our students, and Dashiell Young-Saver of San Antonio, who's become more optimistic about the world after seeing young people's optimism about the world.
ace_sentences: Many students responded.

We received some catchy headlines.
